alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Harlan, Bell, southeastern Knox and southwestern Leslie Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brightshade to Chenoa. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mills and Scalf around 435 PM EDT. Erose around 440 PM EDT. Field around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Clear Creek Springs, Pineville, Beverly, Wasioto, Wallsend, Meldrum, Sandy Fork, Ferndale, Spruce Pine, Saylor, Ponza, East Pineville, Calvin, Varilla and Tacky Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
